message_1:
A delivery company has to transport packages from one location to another location using a fleet of vehicles. The company wants to minimize the total distance traveled by their vehicles while ensuring that all packages are delivered within a given time frame. The company has identified 5 distribution centers and 10 delivery locations. The distances between the distribution centers and delivery locations are given in the table below:

|  -  |  D1  |  D2  |  D3  |  D4  |  D5  |
|:--:|:----:|:----:|:----:|:----:|:----:|
| P1 |  10  |  12  |  8   |  11  |  6   |
| P2 |  9   |  11  |  7   |  10  |  9   |
| P3 |  8   |  15  |  10  |  14  |  5   |
| P4 |  11  |  14  |  7   |  13  |  12  |
| P5 |  12  |  13  |  11  |  12  |  7   |
| P6 |  6   |  16  |  12  |  15  |  8   |
| P7 |  9   |  13  |  6   |  12  |  10  |
| P8 |  5   |  9   |  8   |  11  |  12  |
| P9 |  7   |  15  |  11  |  12  |  6   |
|P10 |  8   |  10  |  9   |  14  |  11  |

Suppose the company uses three vehicles and each vehicle can carry up to 4 packages at once. Determine the optimal routing for the vehicles that minimizes the total distance traveled, ensuring that all packages are delivered within 6 hours.
message_2:
To solve this problem, we can use a clustering algorithm to group the packages into three clusters, each representing the packages that will be delivered by one vehicle. Then, we can use the nearest neighbor algorithm to find the optimal route for each vehicle within its cluster.

1. Clustering Algorithm: We can use the K-means clustering algorithm with K=3 to group the packages into three clusters. The centroids of the clusters will represent the distribution centers.

2. Nearest Neighbor Algorithm: For each cluster, we can use the nearest neighbor algorithm to find the optimal route for the vehicle within its cluster. The algorithm starts at the distribution center and iteratively selects the nearest package until all packages in the cluster are delivered.

Applying the K-means clustering algorithm on the given data, we get the following clusters:

Cluster 1 (D1): P1, P2, P6, P8
Cluster 2 (D3): P3, P4, P7, P9
Cluster 3 (D5): P5, P10

Now, we apply the nearest neighbor algorithm for each cluster:

Cluster 1 (D1): D1 -> P8 (5) -> P6 (6) -> P1 (10) -> P2 (9) -> D1
Total distance: 5 + 6 + 10 + 9 = 30

Cluster 2 (D3): D3 -> P7 (6) -> P4 (7) -> P9 (11) -> P3 (10) -> D3
Total distance: 6 + 7 + 11 + 10 = 34

Cluster 3 (D5): D5 -> P5 (7) -> P10 (11) -> D5
Total distance: 7 + 11 = 18

The optimal routing for the vehicles that minimizes the total distance traveled is:

Vehicle 1: D1 -> P8 -> P6 -> P1 -> P2 -> D1
Vehicle 2: D3 -> P7 -> P4 -> P9 -> P3 -> D3
Vehicle 3: D5 -> P5 -> P10 -> D5

The total distance traveled by all vehicles is 30 + 34 + 18 = 82.
